member.name: T:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32API
member.summary: Wrapper class over Win32 Native methods

member.name: M:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32API.ObjectFromLresult(System.UIntPtr,System.Guid,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Retrives the specified IID object from the Lresult value.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32API.FindWindowByText(System.IntPtr,System.String)
member.summary: Returns the window handle that has text matching what is passed. This is recursive but first it checks all windows at the current level before recursing.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32API.FindWindowByPosition(System.IntPtr,System.Drawing.Point)
member.summary: Find the window whose upper left corner matches the position given. This recurses through all child windows and their children looking for the matching window.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32API.FindWindowByID(System.IntPtr,System.Int32)
member.summary: Find the window whose upper left corner matches the position given. This recurses through all child windows and their children looking for the matching window.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32API.GetWindowText(System.IntPtr,System.Text.StringBuilder,System.Int32)
member.summary: Interop to base Windows OS call to get windows text. This is limited to getting any text for the current process or the caption for a control from other processes. In other words, you can read the text of a button in any process but you can't read the text of an editbox in another process.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32API.GetWindowText(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: A 'friendly' way to get the window's text. This is limited to getting any text for the current process or the caption for a control from other processes. In other words, you can read the text of a button in any process but you can't read the text of an editbox in another process.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32API.GetWindowTextAny(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: A 'friendly' way to get the window's text. This works with any control in any process.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32API.SetWindowTextAny(System.IntPtr,System.String)
member.summary: This is used to set the window text for controls in another process. SetWindowText() only works within the same process.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32API.GetTickCount
member.summary: To help wait for a number of milliseconds

member.name: M:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32API.GetSystemMenu(System.IntPtr,System.Int32)
member.summary: For working with System Menus (under the upper-left hand controlbox)

member.name: M:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32API.EnableApplicationClose(System.Windows.Forms.Form,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
This gets a handle to the system menu, what you see when you click the controlbox in the upper left corner of the app. It then disables the close command on the menu which also disables the 'x' on the top right side of the window.
EnableApplicationClose(false);// disables the form's 'x' button EnableApplicationClose(true); // allows the app to be close with the x button
member.param: The form whose controlbox is being affected.
true if enabling, false if disabling

member.name: M:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32API.SetRedraw(System.IntPtr,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Turns on (or off) the redrawing of a control when it changes. After turning redraw on, you still need to force a redraw. This only works with true Win32 controls.
member.param: handle of window to affect
true to permit redraw, false to block

member.name: M:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32API.SetFocus(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Posts a request to make the given window have the focus. Delayed compared to using SendMessage.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32API.ExtractIconA(System.Int32,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads an icon from an executable or DLL file

member.name: M:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32API.ShowWindow(System.IntPtr,Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32API.ShowWindowValues)
member.summary: Cause a window's visible state to change.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32API.ShowWindowAsync(System.IntPtr,Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32API.ShowWindowValues)
member.summary: Cause a window's visible state to change asynchronously.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32API.CloseWindow(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Requests that a window or application close itself.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32API.RealGetWindowClass(System.IntPtr,System.Text.StringBuilder,System.UInt32)
member.summary: The RealGetWindowClass function retrieves a string that specifies the window type.
member.param: [in] Handle to the window whose type will be retrieved.
[out] Pointer to a string that receives the window type.
[in] Specifies the length of the StringBuilder buffer pointed to by the pszType parameter.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is the number of TCHAR copied to the specified buffer. If the function fails, the return value is zero. To get extended error information, call GetLastError.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32API.CreateWindowEx(System.Int32,System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.Object)
member.summary: Creates an overlapped, pop-up, or child window with an extended window style; otherwise, this function is identical to the CreateWindow function. For more information about creating a window and for full descriptions of the other parameters of CreateWindowEx see CreateWindow
member.param: The extended window style of the window being created. For a list of possible values,see Extended Window Styles.

A null-terminated string or a class atom created by a previous call to the RegisterClass or RegisterClassEx function. The atom must be in the low-order word of lpClassName; the high-order word must be zero. If lpClassName is a string, it specifies the window class name. The class name can be any name registered with RegisterClass or RegisterClassEx, provided that the module that registers the class is also the module that creates the window. The class name can also be any of the predefined system class names.

The window name. If the window style specifies a title bar, the window title pointed to by lpWindowName is displayed in the title bar. When using CreateWindow to create controls, such as buttons, check boxes, and static controls, use lpWindowName to specify the text of the control. When creating a static control with the SS_ICON style, use lpWindowName to specify the icon name or identifier. To specify an identifier, use the syntax "#num".

member.name: M:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32API.DestroyWindow(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Destroys the specified window. The function sends WM_DESTROY and WM_NCDESTROY messages to the window to deactivate it and remove the keyboard focus from it. The function also destroys the window's menu, flushes the thread message queue, destroys timers, removes clipboard ownership, and breaks the clipboard viewer chain (if the window is at the top of the viewer chain).
member.param: A handle to the window to be destroyed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32API.PeekMessage(Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32API.Message@,System.IntPtr,System.UInt32,System.UInt32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Dispatches incoming sent messages, checks the thread message queue for a posted message, and retrieves the message (if any exist).

member.name: M:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32API.ShellExecuteEx(Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32API.SHELLEXECUTEINFO@)
member.summary: Performs an operation on a specified file.
member.param: A pointer to a SHELLEXECUTEINFO structure that contains and receives information about the application being executed.
member.returns: Returns TRUE if successful; otherwise, FALSE.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32API.ShellExecute(System.IntPtr,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32API.ShowCommands)
member.summary: Performs an operation on a specified file.
member.param: A handle to the parent window used for displaying a UI or error messages.
A pointer to a null-terminated string, referred to in this case as a verb, that specifies the action to be performed.
A pointer to a null-terminated string that specifies the file or object on which to execute the specified verb.
If lpFile specifies an executable file, this parameter is a pointer to a null-terminated string that specifies the parameters to be passed to the application.
A pointer to a null-terminated string that specifies the default (working) directory for the action.
The flags that specify how an application is to be displayed when it is opened.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, it returns a value greater than 32. If the function fails, it returns an error value that indicates the cause of the failure.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32API.GetClassName(System.IntPtr,System.Text.StringBuilder,System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves the name of the class to which the specified window belongs.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32API.GetWindow(System.Runtime.InteropServices.HandleRef,System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves a handle to a window that has the specified relationship (Z-Order or owner) to the specified window.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32API.IsWindow(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Check Is the Handle associated to a window.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32API.AttachThreadInput(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Attaches the input processing mechanism of one thread to that of another thread.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32API.GetNamedPipeClientProcessId(System.IntPtr,System.UInt32@)
member.summary: To Fetch the connected client process id.
member.param: Pipe handle as IntPtr.
Client process id as uint.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32API.GetNamedPipeServerProcessId(System.IntPtr,System.UInt32@)
member.summary: To Fetch the connected server process id.
member.param: Pipe handle as IntPtr.
Server process id as uint.

members.member:
ShowWindowValues has been deprecated, please use ShowCommands instead. Values used for the ShowWindow() command to control the visibilty of a window.
[TODO :- Uncomment the below]

member.name: F:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32API.SHELLEXECUTEINFO.cbSize
member.summary: Required. The size of this structure, in bytes.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32API.SHELLEXECUTEINFO.fMask
member.summary: Flags that indicate the content and validity of the other structure members

member.name: F:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32API.SHELLEXECUTEINFO.hwnd
member.summary: Optional. A handle to the parent window, used to display any message boxes that the system might produce while executing this function.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32API.SHELLEXECUTEINFO.lpVerb
member.summary: A string, referred to as a verb, that specifies the action to be performed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32API.SHELLEXECUTEINFO.lpFile
member.summary: The address of a null-terminated string that specifies the name of the file or object on which ShellExecuteEx will perform the action specified by the lpVerb parameter.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32API.SHELLEXECUTEINFO.lpParameters
member.summary: Optional. The address of a null-terminated string that contains the application parameters.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32API.SHELLEXECUTEINFO.lpDirectory
member.summary: Optional. The address of a null-terminated string that specifies the name of the working directory.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32API.SHELLEXECUTEINFO.nShow
member.summary: Required. Flags that specify how an application is to be shown when it is opened;

member.name: F:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32API.SHELLEXECUTEINFO.hInstApp
member.summary: If SEE_MASK_NOCLOSEPROCESS is set and the ShellExecuteEx call succeeds, it sets this member to a value greater than 32.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32API.SHELLEXECUTEINFO.lpIDList
member.summary: The address of an absolute ITEMIDLIST structure (PCIDLIST_ABSOLUTE) to contain an item identifier list that uniquely identifies the file to execute.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32API.SHELLEXECUTEINFO.lpClass
member.summary: The address of a null-terminated string.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32API.SHELLEXECUTEINFO.hkeyClass
member.summary: A handle to the registry key for the file type.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32API.SHELLEXECUTEINFO.dwHotKey
member.summary: A keyboard shortcut to associate with the application.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32API.SHELLEXECUTEINFO.hIcon
member.summary: A handle to the icon for the file type.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32API.SHELLEXECUTEINFO.hProcess
member.summary: A handle to the newly started application.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32API.SetWindowPosFlags.SWP_ASYNCWINDOWPOS
member.summary: If the calling thread and the thread that owns the window are attached to different input queues, the system posts the request to the thread that owns the window. This prevents the calling thread from blocking its execution while other threads process the request.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32API.SetWindowPosFlags.SWP_DEFERERASE
member.summary: Prevents generation of the WM_SYNCPAINT message.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32API.SetWindowPosFlags.SWP_DRAWFRAME
member.summary: Draws a frame (defined in the window's class description) around the window.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32API.SetWindowPosFlags.SWP_FRAMECHANGED
member.summary: Applies new frame styles set using the SetWindowLong function. Sends a WM_NCCALCSIZE message to the window, even if the window's size is not being changed. If this flag is not specified, WM_NCCALCSIZE is sent only when the window's size is being changed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32API.SetWindowPosFlags.SWP_NOACTIVATE
member.summary: Does not activate the window. If this flag is not set, the window is activated and moved to the top of either the topmost or non-topmost group (depending on the setting of the hWndInsertAfter parameter).

member.name: F:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32API.SetWindowPosFlags.SWP_NOCOPYBITS
member.summary: Discards the entire contents of the client area. If this flag is not specified, the valid contents of the client area are saved and copied back into the client area after the window is sized or repositioned.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32API.SetWindowPosFlags.SWP_NOMOVE
member.summary: Retains the current position (ignores X and Y parameters).

member.name: F:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32API.SetWindowPosFlags.SWP_NOOWNERZORDER
member.summary: Does not change the owner window's position in the Z order.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32API.SetWindowPosFlags.SWP_NOREDRAW
member.summary: Does not redraw changes. If this flag is set, no repainting of any kind occurs. This applies to the client area, the nonclient area (including the title bar and scroll bars), and any part of the parent window uncovered as a result of the window being moved. When this flag is set, the application must explicitly invalidate or redraw any parts of the window and parent window that need redrawing.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32API.SetWindowPosFlags.SWP_NOSENDCHANGING
member.summary: Prevents the window from receiving the WM_WINDOWPOSCHANGING message.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32API.SetWindowPosFlags.SWP_NOSIZE
member.summary: Retains the current size (ignores the cx and cy parameters).

member.name: F:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32API.SetWindowPosFlags.SWP_NOZORDER
member.summary: Retains the current Z order (ignores the hWndInsertAfter parameter).

member.name: T:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32API.ShowCommands
member.summary: Values used for the ShowWindow() command to control the visibilty of a window.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32API.ShellExecuteMaskFlags
member.summary: Flags that indicate the content and validity of the other structure members.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32API.ShellExecuteMaskFlags.SEE_MASK_CLASSNAME
member.summary: Use the class name given by the lpClass member. If both SEE_MASK_CLASSKEY and SEE_MASK_CLASSNAME are set, the class key is used.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32API.ShellExecuteMaskFlags.SEE_MASK_CLASSKEY
member.summary: Use the class key given by the hkeyClass member. If both SEE_MASK_CLASSKEY and SEE_MASK_CLASSNAME are set, the class key is used.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32API.ShellExecuteMaskFlags.SEE_MASK_IDLIST
member.summary: Use the item identifier list given by the lpIDList member. The lpIDList member must point to an ITEMIDLIST structure.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32API.ShellExecuteMaskFlags.SEE_MASK_INVOKEIDLIST
member.summary: Use the IContextMenu interface of the selected item's shortcut menu handler. Use either lpFile to identify the item by its file system path or lpIDList to identify the item by its PIDL. This flag allows applications to use ShellExecuteEx to invoke verbs from shortcut menu extensions instead of the static verbs listed in the registry.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32API.ShellExecuteMaskFlags.SEE_MASK_HOTKEY
member.summary: Use the keyboard shortcut given by the dwHotKey member.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32API.ShellExecuteMaskFlags.SEE_MASK_NOCLOSEPROCESS
member.summary: Use to indicate that the hProcess member receives the process handle. This handle is typically used to allow an application to find out when a process created with ShellExecuteEx terminates. In some cases, such as when execution is satisfied through a DDE conversation, no handle will be returned. The calling application is responsible for closing the handle when it is no longer needed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32API.ShellExecuteMaskFlags.SEE_MASK_CONNECTNETDRV
member.summary: Validate the share and connect to a drive letter. This enables reconnection of disconnected network drives. The lpFile member is a UNC path of a file on a network.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32API.ShellExecuteMaskFlags.SEE_MASK_NOASYNC
member.summary: Wait for the execute operation to complete before returning.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32API.ShellExecuteMaskFlags.SEE_MASK_DOENVSUBST
member.summary: Expand any environment variables specified in the string given by the lpDirectory or lpFile member.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32API.ShellExecuteMaskFlags.SEE_MASK_FLAG_NO_UI
member.summary: Do not display an error message box if an error occurs.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32API.ShellExecuteMaskFlags.SEE_MASK_UNICODE
member.summary: Use this flag to indicate a Unicode application.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32API.ShellExecuteMaskFlags.SEE_MASK_NO_CONSOLE
member.summary: Use to inherit the parent's console for the new process instead of having it create a new console. It is the opposite of using a CREATE_NEW_CONSOLE flag with CreateProcess.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32API.ShellExecuteMaskFlags.SEE_MASK_HMONITOR
member.summary: Use this flag when specifying a monitor on multi-monitor systems. The monitor is specified in the hMonitor member. This flag cannot be combined with SEE_MASK_ICON.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32API.ShellExecuteMaskFlags.SEE_MASK_NOZONECHECKS
member.summary: Introduced in Windows XP. Do not perform a zone check. This flag allows ShellExecuteEx to bypass zone checking put into place by IAttachmentExecute.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32API.ShellExecuteMaskFlags.SEE_MASK_WAITFORINPUTIDLE
member.summary: After the new process is created, wait for the process to become idle before returning, with a one minute timeout. See WaitForInputIdle for more details.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32API.ShellExecuteMaskFlags.SEE_MASK_FLAG_LOG_USAGE
member.summary: Introduced in Windows XP. Keep track of the number of times this application has been launched. Applications with sufficiently high counts appear in the Start Menu's list of most frequently used programs.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32API.ShellExecuteMaskFlags.SEE_MASK_FLAG_HINST_IS_SITE
member.summary: Introduced in Windows 8. The hInstApp member is used to specify the IUnknown of an object that implements IServiceProvider. This object will be used as a site pointer.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32Api.WindowFinder
member.summary: A utility class that uses a similar algorithm as Process.MainWindowHandle with the added provision that class, text can be provided to select another window. Also especially noticable on Vista, it can take a little time before application windows become visible, hence the acquisitionTimeout loop.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32Api.WindowFinder.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32Api.WindowFinder class with the specified parameters.
member.param: null to avoid matching on class
null to avoid matching on caption
limit FindWindow to windows on process id (pid), use 0 to search all windows on all active pids

member.name: M:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32Api.WindowFinder.FindWindow(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Starts the search for the top window with the designated class and caption text.
member.param: A duration limit (in milliseconds) on the window search.
True to pump windows messages while waiting for target window to appear.
member.returns: A window handle of the found window (or zero if not found.)

member.name: M:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32Api.WindowFinder.FindWindow(System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary: Starts the search for the top window with the designated class and caption text.
member.param: A duration limit (in milliseconds) on the window search.
True to pump windows messages while waiting for target window to appear.
An parameter passed to calls of the EnumWindowsCallback virtual method during the window search.
member.returns: A window handle of the found window (or zero if not found.)

member.name: M:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32Api.WindowFinder.GetProcessIdOfWindow(System.Runtime.InteropServices.HandleRef)
member.summary: Utility method returning the process id corresponding to the specified window.
member.param: A window to find the corresponding pid for.
member.returns: A process id of the process that owns the specified window.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32Api.WindowFinder.EnumWindowsCallback(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Called during FindWindow() for each enumerated window to determine whether the current window is the target. Override to provide custom criteria.
member.param: The current enumerated window.
The extraData parameter provided during the call to FindWindow().
member.returns: True to continue enumeration, false to stop.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32Api.WindowMonitor
member.summary: Internal class supporting the public WindowPositioner class.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32Api.WindowParenter
member.summary: A utility class that transforms the childToBeWindow top window into a child window of parentWindow. Original configuration is reverted when class is Disposed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32Api.WindowParenter.#ctor(System.Runtime.InteropServices.HandleRef,System.Runtime.InteropServices.HandleRef)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32Api.WindowParenter class with the specified parameters.
member.param: Handle to the parent window
Handle to the window to be parented

member.name: M:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32Api.WindowParenter.#ctor(System.Runtime.InteropServices.HandleRef,System.Runtime.InteropServices.HandleRef,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32Api.WindowParenter class with the specified parameters..
member.param: Handle to the parent window
Handle to the window to be parented
when true, will not set the child style on to allow any Win32 menu to appear
true for non-window applications

member.name: M:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32Api.WindowParenter.Dispose
member.summary: Reverts childToBeWindow to its original state.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32Api.WindowParenter.UpdateChildSize
member.summary: Updates the size of the child window if the parent window has been resized.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32Api.WindowPositioner
member.summary: A utility class that moves and sizes PositionedTopWindow over Monitored Window such as to make PositionedTopWindow appear as a child window of Monitored Window. Original configuration is reverted when class is Disposed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32Api.WindowPositioner.#ctor(System.Runtime.InteropServices.HandleRef,System.Runtime.InteropServices.HandleRef,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32Api.WindowPositioner class with the specified parameters.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32Api.WindowPositioner.#ctor(System.Runtime.InteropServices.HandleRef,System.Runtime.InteropServices.HandleRef,System.Runtime.InteropServices.HandleRef,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32Api.WindowPositioner class with the specified parameters.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32Api.WindowPositioner.Activate
member.summary: Transitions PositionedTopWindow to the activated state (updates size, position, z-order.) Does NOT change the visibility state of PositionedTopWindow. Updates WindowShapshot.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32Api.WindowPositioner.Activate(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Transitions PositionedTopWindow to the activated state checks the Winproccall to reduce the flickering (updates size, position, z-order.) Does NOT change the visibility state of PositionedTopWindow. Updates WindowShapshot.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32Api.WindowPositioner.Activate(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Transitions PositionedTopWindow to the activated state at left, top co-oridnates specified (updates size, position, z-order.) Does NOT change the visibility state of PositionedTopWindow. Updates WindowShapshot.
member.param: left coordinate of the window
top coordinate of the window

member.name: M:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32Api.WindowPositioner.Deactivate
member.summary: Transitions PositionedTopWindow to the deactivated state. Does NOT change the visibility state of PositionedTopWindow.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32Api.WindowPositioner.Deactivate(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Transitions PositionedTopWindow to the deactivated state. at left, top co-oridnates specified Does NOT change the visibility state of PositionedTopWindow.
member.param: left coordinate of the window
top coordinate of the window

member.name: M:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32Api.WindowPositioner.ShowWindow(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Shows PositionedTopWindow at left, top co-oridnates specified
member.param: left coordinate of the window
top coordinate of the window

member.name: M:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32Api.WindowPositioner.HideWindow(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Hides PositionedTopWindow at left, top co-oridnates specified.
member.param: left coordinate of the window
top coordinate of the window

member.name: M:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32Api.WindowPositioner.RemoveFromTaskbar
member.summary: Removes the PositionedTopWindow from the Windows taskbar.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32Api.WindowPositioner.RemoveFrameAndCaption
member.summary: Removes the Frame and Caption from the PositionedTopWindow.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32Api.WindowPositioner.RemoveSizingControls
member.summary: Remove the Sizing controls for the Window

member.name: M:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32Api.WindowPositioner.RemoveSystemMenu
member.summary: Removes the system menu (prevents closing, sizing, moving) from PositionedTopWindow.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32Api.WindowPositioner.RemoveSizingMenu
member.summary: Removes the system menu (prevents sizing, moving) from PositionedTopWindow.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32Api.WindowPositioner.WindowSnapshot
member.summary: Snapshot bitmap of the PositionedTopWindow updated on every Deactivate().

member.name: T:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32Api.WindowSnapshot
member.summary: A utility that maintains a bitmap of monitoredWindow.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32Api.WindowSnapshot.#ctor(System.Runtime.InteropServices.HandleRef)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32Api.WindowSnapshot class.
member.param: A window capture bitmap snapshots of.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Win32Api.WindowSnapshot.Update
